{"blocks":[{"key":"2v8j8","text":"Wash the column with   of base buffer, followed by   of wash buffer twice. Allow wash buffer to pass through completely between washes. {"blocks":[{"key":"67kh0","text":"Repeat step 8.5 one more time, collecting a total of 2 separate elution fractions. {"blocks":[{"key":"d74pa","text":"Using 30,000 MWCO spin concentrators, concentrate the fractions, from the rIMAC step,  that contain target protein to a maximum final volume of  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":144,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"evaa0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bmkar","text":"Remove any solid aggregates from the sample by centrifugation at   , then immediately draw up the supernatant with a 5mL syringe and a blunt-tip fill needle, taking care not to disturb the pellet. {"blocks":[{"key":"fdc5a","text":"Wash used IMAC resin with 10CV of base buffer, and leave in the column stored with a small amount of the same buffer such that the resin is kept moist.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1hnpu","text":"This washed IMAC resin will later be reused for reverse IMAC (rIMAC)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3picu","text":"(Optional) elute rIMAC resin with   elution buffer to confirm if the protein shows non-specific binding to the resin used.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":34,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"40cbj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"tpu9","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3a92e","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2","error":false,"guid":"062E8DB6FE5211EE93260A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":3254}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"r8or","text":"This will help determine if the protein is \"sticky\" to the Ni resin matrix material, and help in further troubleshooting if the final yield is lower than expected. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"9rjvo","text":"The main aim of this work was to identify small molecules that bind Zika NS5 RdRp (catalytic RNA-dependent RNA polymerase domain) through X-ray fragment-based screening. The Zika NS5 RDRP domain was cloned, expressed, purified, and crystallised.  Suitable crystals for fragment screening were produced and optimised allowing an extensive fragment campaign to be performed. A native high-resolution structure was determined at 1.8Ã and formed the basis for the fragment campaign.Â  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":93,"length":1},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":97,"length":1},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":107,"length":1},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":111,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
